author: Special Correspondent
text:
Urban Development Minister Venkaiah Naidu on Wednesday urged the Opposition political parties to enable the “early passage” of the Real Estate Bill in the current Parliament session.

“I am hopeful that the Real Estate Bill will be passed in this session”, Mr.Naidu said on the sidelines of a press briefing here.

Mr.Naidu expressed his concern over the ongoing distress in the real estate business and urged the Opposition parties to allow the parliamentary proceedings in the coming days.

Praising the Union Budget, even though the Central funding for two significant urban schemes — Smart City Mission and Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (AMRUT) — was cut massively, Mr.Naidu said that the Finance Ministry had “acknowledged the importance of the urban sector as evident in the allocations”.

“Despite the focus of the Budget for the next fiscal on agriculture and rural development, the urban sector got its due”, Mr.Naidu said.

Highlighting the biggest takeaway of the Budget for the Urban Development Ministry, he said that in this fiscal, the housing and construction sector would get the benefits of “infrastructure status,” which meant developers would get tax breaks and other forms of concessions to speed up the process of construction.

On JNNURM

On Jawaharlal Nehru National Urban Renewal Mission, a policy implemented by the Congress-led UPA government, Mr.Naidu said the programme had taken off slowly and urged the State governments to quickly spend the resources that had been granted to them under the programme.

title: Venkaiah hopeful of passing Real Estate Bill
